message.content:
cs.HC, cs.NI, cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.RO 

The paper discusses the use of virtual and augmented reality as feedback modalities for brain-computer interface systems, which falls under the category of human-computer interaction (cs.HC). The study also involves navigation tasks, which could be classified under the sub-category of robotics (cs.RO). Additionally, the use of visual stimuli and image processing techniques for the BCI system could be relevant to computer vision (cs.CV). Finally, the study involves the use of technology to assist individuals with disabilities, which could be classified under the sub-category of neural engineering (cs.NI).
